intro: Beilschmiedia mannii, commonly known as the African beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by dark, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and mountain rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
